stories.text:
it feels like twitter but more sad..

90% of posters are there for commercial reasons and usually post something which is either a feel good news and the bar is really low, agree with something trending while looking like a contrarian, say something controversial or just ask dumb questions as poll... end goal is to somehow get infront of people so you can promote yourself or your brand.

But then there is sea of people who are like "I am happy to announce that dreams of my grandmother has come true and I'll be writing this life story to show my appreciation that I'll be joining CORPTMINCLTD soon." It's so cringe, and they only get away with it because people don't want to voice negative opinions where future potential employers are.

I really wish there was an alternative, where you could stay connected with colleagues without all the cringe stuff... but wonder what business model would be. Maybe same as linkedin, allowing recruiter email every now and then.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why is LinkedIn so cringe?
Fearing Lawsuits, Factories Rush to Replace Humans with Robots in South Korea
